Sir Williams laughs. "We are doing a great service to the crown -ours, of course- but also the world and your viceroyalty. There are secrets hidden in the temple that we are searching. Secrets that must be kept out of the hands of ...madmen, was it? Secrets worth the defloration of a whore." He looks at me and shrugs. 

The teniente motions a man in the corner with his free hand. The man approaches. He is wearing uniform and armour, but no weapons: "Padre, what do you think?" 

The man raises an eyebrow: "I think that your naked whore is dripping your seed onto your lap, teniente. I also think that it is very inappropriate for your men to fornicate with the other whores. But most of all, I would like to see that temple. These two men..." -he points at Sir Edward and Mr. Jones- "..are studying things not meant for humans. Both are known to be scholars. The sick fool tries to find eternal life by making the world the hell of his master, and the young fool thinks this is all nonsense. I need to check this out. Why don't you hang the pimp and the whores -including the British ones- and we make haste to that place?"

A week later we make camp in a small valley, deep in the Andes. They set up camp like very nervous veterans in enemy territory, but the dragoons off duty greatly enjoy the company of the whores. Alyce and the six village whores suffer a lot, and the former waitress is not getting a special treatment any longer. Other than me: like every night the teniente keeps me for himself. That does NOT mean that I do not have to spread my legs, though. every night the tenente rides me hard. 
[Image: lted]
In the morning the teniente and the padre talk with the British: "Beyond that pass is the temple that we are looking for. We will set up camp here, tighten ranks and go in with everyoman but the camp guards." 

The padre nods: "Let me be abundantly clear: either there is a whole heap of old stones, and we are all fools to be here. Or there is a very real, very dangerous evil in there. You have to decide no whether you are with us: or not. If you are with us, you will be treated like gentlemen prisoners in times of a bandit attack. An attack by bandits that are NOT allied to you, gentlemen." 

I take the teniente's arm off my arse: "Give them the last rites." They stare at me. I shrug: "Give the village whores the last rites before you 'tighten ranks', padre. They belief in that, even if you may not." 

Marcellus sneers: "Do you want to get annointed, too? When they shoot all the whores with lead instead of semen? Or do you still hope that they will spare you and only kill the other whores?" 
I shrug: Whatever.

神父點點頭：「讓我說得很清楚：要么這裡是一堆舊石頭，而我們在這裡都是傻瓜。要么那裡有一個非常真實、非常危險的邪惡。你必須決定是否和我們在一起：或者不。如果你和我們在一起，在強盜襲擊時，你會被當作紳士囚犯對待。這是由與你不結盟的強盜發起的襲擊，先生們。”

While they are shooting the village whores the tenient walks me and Alyce to the side with a couple of dragoons and the padre. Sir William tags along to watch.

When we are more or less alone, the teniente turns to me: "I am a soldier. An officer. I kill poeple for a living. I have sworn to serve: not by getting shot to pieces, but by trying to win. That little French bastard blew us to parts. Us and our doctirne of noble warfare. Pragmatism is the word, so I have become prarmatic, like many of my fellow young officers." 
He kisses my hand: "I do not rue the death of the village whores, or laying a trap for these bandits and shooting them up in their own trap. That is necessary. But my mother would not like that I have made you my whore." 

I smile: "I do not like that, either."

He nods: "There are two kinds of women that are no virgins: whores and wives. You can never be a virgin again, little whore. But you CAN become a wife. I am told that you have an interesting dowry. Your father has thrown you to the wolves for that. He has also given me his blessings to marry you, little whore.
So here is a propostion, while I am cleanig camp: marry me. Then you are a wife, no whore: and I am much richer than I was. If you do, I do not have to shoot you and your bridesmaid. If you do not, we will burry two more whores." 

[Image: ring]I blink. Sir William opens his mouth, and the teniente put his pistol into Sir WIlliam's mouth. His gun pistol. Not the one he is putting into me every night. 

I look around: the dragoons that accompany us are carrying shovels. I guess I either get married or Alyce and I get burried. This will also thwart Sir William, and most women are married for sex and for their dowry. 

Sir William signs some papers, the padre does his thing, and the teniente puts on old ring on my finger: a family heirloom. The moment the ring is on my finger I faint.

當他們射殺村裡的妓女時，租客帶著我和艾莉絲走到一邊，身邊還有幾個龍騎兵和神父。威廉爵士尾隨觀看。

當我們或多或少孤獨時，中尉轉向我：“我是一名士兵。一名軍官。我以殺人為生。我發誓服役：不是被槍殺，而是試圖獲勝。那個法國小混蛋把我們炸成了碎片。我們和我們的高貴戰爭信條。實用主義就是這個詞，所以我變得務實，就像我的許多年輕軍官同伴一樣。”
他親吻我的手：“我並不後悔村里妓女的死，也不後悔為這些強盜設下陷阱，然後把她們射進自己的陷阱裡。那是必要的。但我母親不喜歡我讓你成為我的妓女。”

我笑道：“我也不喜歡這樣。”

他點點頭：「有兩種女人不是處女：妓女和妻子。你永遠不可能再成為處女了，小妓女。但你可以成為妻子。我聽說你有一份有趣的嫁妝。你父親為此把你扔進狼裡。他也祝福我能娶你，小妓女。
所以當我在打掃營地時，有一個提議：嫁給我。那麼你就是一個妻子，而不是妓女：而我比以前更富有了。如果你這樣做，我就不必開槍射殺你和你的伴娘。如果你不這麼做，我們就再埋掉兩個妓女。 」

[圖：戒指]我眨眼。威廉爵士張開嘴，中尉將手槍塞進威廉爵士的嘴裡。他的槍是​​手槍。不是他每晚灌輸給我的那個。 

我環顧四周：陪伴我們的龍騎兵都拿著鏟子。我想我要么結婚，要么艾莉絲和我被埋葬。這也會阻礙威廉爵士，大多數女性結婚是為了性和嫁妝。 

威廉爵士簽署了一些文件，神父做了他的事情，中尉將舊戒指戴在我的手指上：這是一個傳家寶。當戒指戴在手指上的那一刻，我暈倒了。

passages.name: f34
passages.content:
The padre looks down at me. "You are not the first bride to faint, senora. Especially if the bride is as far from being a virgin as you are. But usually brides faint when they and their bastards are left waiting at the altar, not after the ring is put on their finger." Weird words from a padre. If he really is one...

[Image: ring]I look at my wedding band. I smile when I get to study my 'wedding band' in detail.. 
This is a ward against the Liar, The Soul And Messenger Of The Outer Gods. For some reason -maybe to keep entertained- that one has to follow some rules. One of these rules is: wear this sign and you are not beholden by That One. 
Since I am not beholden by him, I am free from the enchantment put on me in His name. My powers are back. 

I get up in a fluid motion, and raise an eyebrow: "Silly me. Where is the briedemaid?" 

One of the dragoons points at her: she is wearing clothes and standing, on her feet. That is not ALL bad, right? 
Alyce is alive and wearing clothes for a change. She seems to hate me less than this morning. Seething rather than boiling hate: she had to take much abuse herself while I only had to lay with the teniente.. 

The padre shrugs: "Care as I do about the fate of heretic whores, there are more problems. We have been beset by monsters several times while you were unconscious, and the expedition group is missing. The British mercenary tells me that YOU of all people may be useful in this situation." 

I look around. "Who is part of the expedition group? And why are you NOT part of it?" 

The padre shrugs: "The teniente has taken Sir William, Sir Edward, Mr. Marston, Mr. Jones and that Mendoza person as well as five dragoons. I am not part of that group because I am the only one that can draw the wards that -together with the bravery of our dragoons- keep this camp from being overrun." 

I nod: "Who is there to go into the temple with me?" 
Miller and Parker.
passages.content_zh:
神父低頭看著我。 「你不是第一個暈倒的新娘，女士。特別是如果新娘和你一樣遠非處女的話。但通常新娘是在她們和她們的私生子在祭壇前等待時暈倒的，而不是在將戒指戴在手指上之後。」神父奇怪的言論。如果他真的是一個…

[圖：戒指]我看著我的結婚戒指。當我開始詳細研究我的「結婚戒指」時，我笑了。 
這是一個對抗說謊者、外神的靈魂和使者的屏障。出於某種原因——也許是為了保持娛樂——人們必須遵守一些規則。這些規則之一是：戴上這個標誌，你就不會受到那個人的束縛。 
因為我不受他的約束，所以我擺脫了以他的名義加在我身上的魔法。我的力量回來了。 

我動作流暢地站起來，揚起一邊眉毛：“我真傻。伴娘在哪裡？”

一名龍騎兵指著她：她穿著衣服，站著。這並不全然是壞事，對吧？ 
艾莉絲還活著，穿的衣服是為了換換衣服。她似乎比今天早上更不恨我了。仇恨不是沸騰，而是沸騰：她自己必須承受很多虐待，而我只需要和中尉躺在一起。 

神父聳聳肩：“雖然我很關心異端妓女的命運，但問題還多。在你昏迷期間，我們已經好幾次被怪物圍攻了，探險隊也失踪了。英國僱傭兵告訴我，在這種情況下，你可能會派上用場。”

我環顧四周。 “誰是探險隊的成員？為什麼你不參加？”

神父聳聳肩：“中尉帶走了威廉爵士、愛德華爵士、馬斯頓先生、瓊斯先生和那個門多薩人，以及五名龍騎兵。我不屬於那個團體，因為我是唯一一個能夠吸引結界的人，與我們龍騎兵的勇敢一起，阻止這個營地被佔領。”

我點頭：“誰能跟我一起進寺廟？”
米勒和帕克。

passages.name: g35
passages.content:
[Image: rapier]   
We arm ourselves, take what equipment we may need and can carry, and walk to the pass with an escort of dragoons, led by the sargento: "We have lost half of our men -lost and destroyed the bodies- but we have also destroyed some twenty or so of these madmen. One cannot keep precise count in this kind of fight, Donna Fontana. That has visible reduced our attackers. There are -in our estimate- half a dozen of less of them left: that we have seen. Good luck: and I hope that you manage to safe the teniente ...and your family." He salutes. 

Interesting. He pretends to respect my, but he does not. He is not struggling with the idea of his teniente marrying a very used woman. He is ...amused, not angry... when he adresses me as 'Donna Fontana'. His care for the teniente is real, though: as is his complete lack of care for everyone else. 

We walk down into the valley, and when we are out of hearing I stop. "Parker, Miller: you have seen these 'madmen' in combat. How do they fight? Why is the sagento afraid and the padre confused?" 

Miller shrugs: "They look like humans -all of them are Spanish, wearing old conquistador uniforms if anything- and none of them is human. Their heads open at the crown and unfold into ...three maws that look like a cheese grater with hooked teeth as grates, for lack of better description. These three ...maws... wrap around limps -or a head- and when they pull back they leave nothing but the bone. They can be destroyed, but only when they are burnt they are really dead. Otherwise their bodes start to rebuild while one watches." 

I frown: "Well, I need to see one of these in action. Here is our tactic: If we get jumped by one or two of them, Parker and I engage it or them in close combat while Miller prepares the blackpowder to burn them. If we are getting overron by three or more, the two of you drop to the floor and cover. Covering your heads, especially your eyes, is a good idea." I draw the rapier that the sargento has gi
passages.content_zh:
[圖：劍桿]
我們武裝好自己，帶上我們可能需要和可以攜帶的裝備，在薩根托率領的龍騎兵護衛下步行到山口：「我們已經失去了一半的人——失去並摧毀了屍體——但我們也摧毀了大約二十個左右的這些瘋子。 

有趣的。他假裝尊重我，但事實並非如此。他並沒有因為自己的男主人要娶一個習慣了的女人而苦苦掙扎。當他稱我為「唐娜·豐塔納」時，他……很有趣，而不是生氣。不過，他對中尉的關心是真實的：就像他對其他人完全缺乏關心一樣。 

我們走進山谷，當我們聽不見聲音時，我停了下來。 「帕克、米勒：你們在戰鬥中見過這些『瘋子』。他們是如何戰鬥的？為什麼聖人害怕而神父困惑？”

米勒聳聳肩：「他們看起來像人類——全都是西班牙人，如果有的話，都穿著舊的征服者制服——而且沒有一個是人類。他們的頭在頭頂處張開，展開成……三個胃，看起來像一個奶酪刨絲器，有鉤狀的牙齒作為格柵，因為缺乏更好的描述。 

我皺起眉頭：「好吧，我需要看看其中一個的行動。這是我們的策略：如果我們被其中一兩個人撲倒，帕克和我會與它或他們進行近戰，而米勒則準備黑火藥來燒毀他們。如果我們被三個或更多人擊敗，你們兩個就遮住地面並掩護。

passages.name: g36
passages.content:
[Image: rapier]
We are getting jumped by one of the servant creatures. Parker and I hack it to pieces, Miller sets it ablaze. Impressivee. They are both as good as I was hoping. 

The servant creature is also impressive. "Interesting. The basis is a Spanish conquistador. Heavily modified by that worm in his chest." I point at the white slome in the buring body where the heart is in human bodies. "Burning really well and smelling like ...burning human fat." 

I raise an eyebrow: "If someone was crossing humans with giant death worms, this would be the result. With a little extra: changing existing bodies -like the dead conquistadores- like this is beyond a normal paraste. That requires ...power." 

I sigh: "Educated guess, but let us assume there is a powerful -like nearly divine powerful- being with some absurd weirdness imprisoned in that temple. That ...being... is kept there by some wards that are very, very old. And -since this is Peru, once the Incea Empire and before that something else entirely- these wards are made from gold. The most durable metal available in these mountains. 
Sometime -about two centuries ago- a band of conquistadores came here, massacred the guards if there were any left and started prying off the gold. 
Whatever dwells down there reached out: and voila, human-sized maggots hunting for human fat. That same being probably also reached out to somenone else and offered a ...deal instead: because the maggotmen are not really able to break the rest of the wards. The one who took that deal  would be..." 

Parker snorts: "Mendoza." 
Miller shakes his head: "Sir Edward." 

I think that Miller is right. Time will tell.
passages.content_zh:
[圖：劍桿]
我們被僕人生物撲倒了。帕克和我把它劈成碎片，米勒點燃它。令人印象深刻。他們都像我希望的那樣好。 

僕人生物也令人印象深刻。 「有趣。原型是一位西班牙征服者。被他胸口的那條蟲子嚴重改造了。」我指著燃燒體內的白色黏液，那裡是人體的心臟。 “燃燒得非常好，聞起來就像……燃燒人類脂肪。”

我揚起一邊眉毛：“如果有人用巨大的死亡蠕蟲與人類雜交，結果就會是這樣。再加一點額外的東西：改變現有的身體——比如死去的征服者——就像這超出了正常的寄生蟲。這需要……力量。”

我嘆了口氣：「有根據的猜測，但讓我們假設有一個強大的——幾乎是神聖的強大的——帶著某種荒謬的怪異被囚禁在這座寺廟裡。那個……存在……被一些非常非常古老的守衛關押在那裡。而且——因為這裡是秘魯，曾經是因西亞帝國，而在此之前完全是其他國家——這些守衛是用金子製成的這些。
大約兩個世紀前的某個時候，一群征服者來到這裡，屠殺了剩下的守衛，並開始掠奪黃金。 
不管住在下面的東西都伸出手來：瞧，人類大小的蛆蟲正在尋找人類的脂肪。同樣的存在可能也向其他人伸出了援手，並提出了一項……交易：因為蛆人並不能真正破壞其餘的守衛。接受這筆交易的人將是…”

帕克哼了一聲：“門多薩。”
米勒搖搖頭：“愛德華爵士。”

我認為米勒是對的。時間會證明一切。

passages.name: power
passages.content:
In terms that Miller and Parker do not need to understand: a nascent Great Old One. Beings somewhere -in matters of power and relevance- between the weak human gods that now only exist in the Lands of Dream and the Outer Gods that make and unmake worlds in mad revulsions. 

YIg, the Father of the serpentmen, is a Great Old One. So is Earthtoad, who has stolen the minds of too many serpentmen: Great Yig became jelaous and now most serpentmen are born as mindless cripples. The god of the Deep Ones, the fishmen, is another Great Old One: Great Cthulhu. 

Great Old Ones are -occasionally- "born". If so, all mortals -deep ones and humans and serpentmen and others- should tremble in their very bones. Because while they cannot overthroow the Outer Gods (they have tried) they are terrible and utterly beyond mortal control.

Only ONE ...being... keeps nascent Great Old Ones like a human scholar keeps butterflies, pinned in a showing case: 
the Liar, Nyarlathotep: The Soul And The Nessenger Of The Outer Gods.
[Image: sizechart]
passages.content_zh:
用米勒和帕克不需要理解的術語來說：一個新生的舊日支配者。在力量和相關性方面，存在者介於現在僅存在於夢境之地的弱人類神和在瘋狂的厭惡中創造和毀滅世界的外神之間。 

伊格，蛇人之父，是一位偉大的舊日支配者。土蟾蜍也是如此，它偷走了太多蛇人的思想：偉大的伊格變得嫉妒，現在大多數蛇人生來都是無意識的殘廢。深潛魚人之神是另一位舊日支配者：偉大克蘇魯。 

偉大的舊日支配者有時會「誕生」。如果是這樣，所有凡人──深淵生物、人類、蛇人和其他人──都應該從骨子裡顫抖。因為雖然他們無法推翻外神（他們已經嘗試過），但他們是可怕的，完全超出了凡人的控制範圍。

只有一個……存在……像人類學者飼養蝴蝶一樣飼養新生的舊日支配者，並將其固定在展示盒中：
說謊者奈亞拉托提普：外神的靈魂與使者。
[圖：尺寸表]

passages.name: g37
passages.content:
[Image: rapier]
They are taking this in stride, as if they had already knewn about the stark reality behind human  delusions. Interesting, but not in a good sense. Humans -trueblooded ones- do not accept this as easily. They simply cannot do that. Marcellus is a human being, and he -she, whatever- snapped when she or he realized that there is magic. 

I sigh: "Not to be rude, but may I assume that you represent a consortium with mining interests in the Americas ...and the Himalaya, in the borderlands with India?" Parker nods. 

I turn to Miller: "Your mother is from Dunwich, I assume." Miller nods, somewhat surprised. So he does not know yet. Huh. He does not have bulging eyes and a sore throat: but not all of them do. 

I shrug. "Let us proceed. We ALL need to stop this. Not only for our own individual survival but also to protect the interests of your masters." 

Things being what they are, I let my hair down some, so to speak: we head to the ossarium first. The Inca used to sacrifice body fluid to the gods. Mostly blood. The remains of the donors were collected in side rooms for exactly the purpose that I am applying them to: I raise the bones from the dead. Well: those that are still intact and can be raised. 
I am, among my people, especially gifted in that art: necromancy.
passages.content_zh:
[圖：劍桿]
他們泰然處之，彷彿他們已經了解了人類妄想背後的嚴酷現實。有趣，但不是很好的意義上。人類──純血統的人類──不會輕易接受這一點。他們根本不能那樣做。馬塞勒斯是一個人，當他或她意識到有魔法時，他或她，無論如何都會崩潰。 

我嘆了口氣：「不想無禮，但我可以假設您代表的是一個在美洲……以及與印度接壤的喜馬拉雅地區擁有採礦權益的財團嗎？」帕克點點頭。 

我轉向米勒：「我猜你的母親來自鄧維奇。」米勒點點頭，有些驚訝。所以他還不知道。呵呵。他沒有眼睛凸出和喉嚨痛：但並非所有人都有。 

我聳聳肩。 “讓我們繼續。我們都需要阻止這一切。不僅是為了我們自己的生存，也是為了保護你們主人的利益。”

事情就是這樣，我放鬆了一些，可以這麼說：我們首先前往藏骨館。印加人過去常向眾神獻祭液。主要是血。捐贈者的遺體被收集在側室中，正是為了我應用它們的目的：我從死者中復活骨頭。嗯：那些仍然完好無損並且可以飼養的。 
在我的人民中，我在這門藝術上尤其有天賦：死靈術。

passages.name: masters
passages.content:
Later. 

Miss Marston is only guessing. 

For those in the know: there is a Dunwich in England, too: East Essex. A coastal town, to no one's surprose. With lots of good fishing but very rude and ugly people. 
[Image: mortals]
The Andes, the Rockies and the Mimalaye are among the mountain rangers on earth where rare minerals can by mined: not with temporary human technology, of course. It would also help if one could, well: fly. 
The East India Company is sending expeditions into the Humalaya, too: of course. Sometimes they meet the locals.

No one really pays attention to Parker or Miller, unlike Miss Merston -sorry: Donna Fontana- who was watched by everyone when she got banged on the brothel table.

Back to a Peruvian temple ruin.
passages.content_zh:
之後。 

馬斯頓小姐只是猜測。 

對於那些知情者來說：英格蘭也有一個鄧維奇：東埃塞克斯。一個沿海小鎮，不足為奇。有很多很好的釣魚場所，但人們非常粗魯和醜陋。 
[圖：凡人]
安地斯山脈、洛磯山脈和米馬拉耶山脈是地球上可以開採稀有礦物的山脈之一：當然，這不是人類臨時技術所能開採的。如果一個人能夠飛，那也會有幫助。 
當然，東印度公司也正在派遣探險隊前往烏馬拉雅地區。有時他們會遇到當地人。

沒有人真正關注帕克或米勒，不像默斯頓小姐——對不起：唐娜·豐塔納——當她在妓院的桌子上被撞時，所有人都在看著她。

回到秘魯寺廟遺址。

passages.name: g38
passages.content:
[Image: rapier] 
We get jumped again, this time by three of the maggotbeasts: but my skeletons manage to hold them down until we have set them on fire. Sadly we also loose my ten skeletons. 

Parker raises an eyebrow: "Bruja, eh? Who would have thought that a posh girl like you has learned the black arts of the Haitiian slaves before she became a whore?" Well, I guess he has met a Bruja. Or mambo. The ones sold as slaves sometimes ...turn sour... and do their black arts with both the living and the dead. Back in Africa they usually make living zombies.

Miller shrugs: "Marston Manor is in the Cornish hills, Parker. That is also an old country. Roman ruins, right behind the skullery. With deep catacombs that the twins liked to play in." I blink and sigh: I may have been a little unsubtle as a child, and Marcella following my steps has not helpded. But those ruins are not Roman, not the oldest, deepest parts. 
Marcella COULD have learned a lot about magic down there, but she was a child. I was, well: reborn as a child. Big difference...

We turn around another corner in the ancient Incam walls, and stand before a pyramid. 
Waiting for us are Sir Edward, Mendoza, Sir WIlliam and Marcellus. 
Teniente Fontana and Mr. Jones are lying on the stone plates, bound and blindfolded.
passages.content_zh:
[圖：劍桿]
我們再次被跳躍，這次是被三隻蛆獸攻擊：但我的骷髏成功地壓制住了它們，直到我們將它們點燃。可悲的是我們也失去了我的十具骷髏。 

帕克挑起一邊眉毛：「布魯賈，嗯？誰能想到像你這樣的時髦女孩在成為妓女之前就學會了海地奴隸的黑魔法？」嗯，我猜他遇到了布魯賈。或者曼波。那些被賣為奴隸的人有時……會變壞……並對生者和死者施展他們的妖術。在非洲，他們通常會製造活殭屍。

米勒聳聳肩：「馬斯頓莊園在康沃爾山上，帕克。那也是一個古老的國家。羅馬廢墟，就在骷髏後面。有很深的地下墓穴，雙胞胎喜歡在裡面玩耍。」我眨了眨眼，嘆了口氣：我小時候可能有點不懂事，瑪塞拉跟著我的腳步也無濟於事。但那些廢墟不是羅馬的，也不是最古老、最深處的部分。 
瑪塞拉本可以在那裡學到很多關於魔法的知識，但她還是個孩子。我，好：重生為一個孩子。差別很大...

我們繞過古老的因卡姆城牆的另一個角落，站在一座金字塔前。 
等待我們的是愛德華爵士、門多薩爵士、威廉爵士和馬塞勒斯爵士。 
豐塔納中尉和瓊斯先生被綁住並蒙住眼睛，躺在石板上。

passages.name: g39
passages.content:
Sir Edward smiles. "Welcome. You took your sweat time, young ...is it 'whore' or 'donna'? Or both?" 

Sir William nods at Miller. Miller tales the blindfolds off Teniente Fontana and Mr. Jones and walks over to the  side of Sir WIlliam. Parker looks at the two groups, shrugs and walks over to Sir Edward's side. Mendoza growls, quite unlike a rational human being. Well: a rational or a human being. 
[Image: standoff]
I smile and blast Mendoza into green slime on the pyramid wall. I raise an eyebrow: "While we are exchanging pawns... Does this count as a sacrifice? After all the Great Maggot One down in that pit had already gotten to Mendoza. Impressive: he was the only one with a maggot as a heart that could behave -remotely- like a living human being." 

Sir Edward smirks: "Daring, little whore. But let us not speak of sacrifices. Let us talk about chances. This is an old ruin. Once there were monsters: but you have destroyed all of these ...let us call them maggot-men. I promise that there are none left. What IS left are the old wards. GOLDEN wards. I suggest that we take the gold and get out of here. 
If you are with us, little whore: welcome. If not, we can dispose of anypne who does not like this by kicking them down that pit." He looks at the prisoners: "Teniente ... Mr. Jones. You both get the same offer. AND a boon: the first one of you to join us gets to keep the whore. I know that you both want her." 

I shrug: "I would hate to free the prisoner down in the pit. Because all these gold wards keep the very being inside that TURNED Spanish conquistadores into fat sucking monsters in the first place." 

Sir WIlliam  pats his leg with his right hand -at the side, where Sir Edwad cannot see it, and shows Marcellus and Miller his middle finger. Miller shoots Sir Edward in the head.
passages.content_zh:
愛德華爵士微笑著。 “歡迎。年輕人，你花了很多時間……是‘妓女’還是‘唐娜’？還是兩者都有？”

威廉爵士向米勒點點頭。米勒講述了豐塔納中尉和瓊斯先生被蒙住眼睛的故事，然後走到威廉爵士身邊。帕克看著這兩個人，聳聳肩，走到愛德華爵士身邊。門多薩咆哮著，完全不像理性的人。嗯：一個理性的人或一個人。 
[圖：對峙]
我微笑著將門多薩炸成金字塔牆上的綠色黏液。我揚起一邊眉毛：“當我們交換棋子的時候……這算不算一種犧牲？畢竟那個深坑里的蛆蟲大帝已經到達了門多薩。令人印象深刻的是：他是唯一一個擁有蛆蟲心臟並且能夠像活人一樣遠程行動的人。”

愛德華爵士傻笑道：「大膽，小妓女。但我們不要談論犧牲。讓我們談談機會。這是一個古老的廢墟。曾經有怪物：但你已經摧毀了所有這些......讓我們稱他們為蛆人。我保證沒有留下任何東西。剩下的是舊病房。黃金病房。我建議我們帶著金子離開這裡。
如果你和我們在一起，小妓女：歡迎。如果沒有，我們可以把任何不喜歡這樣的人踢到坑裡去處理他們。他看著囚犯們：「中尉……瓊斯先生。你們都得到了同樣的待遇。還有一個好處：你們中第一個加入我們的人可以保留那個妓女。我知道你們都想要她。 」

我聳聳肩：“我不想把囚犯釋放到坑里。因為所有這些黃金守衛都把西班牙征服者變成了抽脂怪物的本質留在了裡面。”

威廉爵士用右手拍了拍他的腿——在埃德瓦德爵士看不到的地方，並向馬塞勒斯和米勒展示了他的中指。米勒開槍射中愛德華爵士的頭部。

passages.name: g40
passages.content:
Sir William raises an eyebrow: "There seems to be a slight misunderstanding. I am not here to GAIN magical power. I am here to get rdid of a magically empowered enemy." 

I raise an eyebrow and ask in Latin: "Do you insist, William?"  

Sir William sighs and answers in kind: "No, not really. I was not aware that you are relatively ...restrained. 
But you have not done that..." -he points at the green smear that was Mendoua- "...to any human being, and you are not attacking me and mine blindly even though I have declared myself in public." 
He points at dead body of Sir Edward and the green smear that was Mendoza and adds in English: "I guess that this is the REAL enemy. Monsters made by thing like the one down in that pit; and those that want to free it. 
I still think that YOU are a monster, old friend. But nonetheless you are a monster that makes and keeps treaties. 
THESE monsters and their servants do not parley. We have to choose our enemies, I guess. 
What about a cessefire? You cannot possibly return to Britain as a whore, can you?"

I raise an eyebrow: "I got happy news for you, father. I got married. I do not mind a mutual pact of non-aggression, as long as we seperate fortunes and you do not intervene with me going where I want to be. Oh: and I want Marston Manor as my dowry. You are not using it anymore, and that is a very small compensation for your betrayal." 

Sir William shrugs: "Done. You get Marston Manor and the money that you have put up for my daughter's dowry: only fitting since you ARE my daughter now." 

I would LIKE to kill him and Macellus, but I am too old to kill all my enemies.
passages.content_zh:
威廉爵士揚起一邊眉毛：“似乎有一點誤會。我來這裡不是為了獲得魔法力量。我來這裡是為了消滅一個擁有魔法力量的敵人。”

我揚起眉毛，用拉丁語問道：“你堅持嗎，威廉？”

威廉爵士嘆了口氣，並以同樣的方式回答：「不，不是。我不知道你相對……內斂。
但你並沒有這樣做……」——他指著門杜瓦的綠色污點——「……對任何人來說，儘管我已經公開宣布自己的身份，但你並沒有盲目地攻擊我和我的。 」
他指著愛德華爵士的屍體和門多薩的綠色污跡，用英語補充道：「我猜這才是真正的敵人。怪物是由坑裡的怪物製造的，還有那些想要釋放它的人。
我仍然認為你是個怪物，老朋友。但儘管如此，你仍然是一個制定並遵守條約的怪物。 
這些怪物和他們的僕人不談判。我想我們必須選擇我們的敵人。 
停火又如何？你不可能以妓女的身份回到英國，不是嗎？ 」

我揚起眉毛：“我給你帶來了好消息，父親。我結婚了。我不介意互不侵犯的條約，只要我們分開財產，你不干涉我去我想去的地方。哦：我想要馬斯頓莊園作為我的嫁妝。你不再使用它了，這對你的背叛來說是一個很小的補償。”

威廉爵士聳聳肩：“好了。你得到了馬斯頓莊園，還有你為我女兒做嫁妝的錢：這很合適，因為你現在是我的女兒了。”

我想殺死他和馬塞勒斯，但我太老了，無法殺死我所有的敵人。

passages.name: g41
passages.content:
Parker raises an eyebrow: "Heart-warming. All this talk about betrayal and all that makes me swoon with happiness. There is still the matter of GOLD:" 

I shrug: "Miller, please throw one of your bombs down there. Set to explode after a drop of twelve yards if you can do that." 

Miller looks at Sir William, who nods. When the barrel full of blackpowder and nails explodes, something down their screetches. 

I turn to Parker: "You can set that free. You will get about 20 pounds of gold and a worm inside your chest that makes you one of the fat-sucking man-maggots. You will also be one of MANY since the maggot down there will be free to crawl the lang. Interested?"

Parker shrugs and shakes his head. Very good: we do not need to kill Parker, either.
passages.content_zh:
帕克揚起一邊眉毛：“暖心。所有這些關於背叛的談論都讓我欣喜若狂。還有黃金的問題：”

我聳聳肩：“米勒，請把你的一枚炸彈扔到那裡。如果你能做到的話，就在十二碼後爆炸。”

米勒看著威廉爵士，威廉爵士點點頭。當裝滿黑火藥和釘子的桶子爆炸時，他們會發出尖叫聲。 

我轉向帕克：“你可以把它放開。你會得到大約 20 磅的黃金，還有一條在你胸口的蠕蟲，這使你成為吸脂人蛆之一。你也將成為眾多蛆中的一員，因為那裡的蛆可以自由地爬行。有興趣嗎？”

帕克聳聳肩，搖搖頭。很好：我們也不需要殺死帕克。

passages.name: g42
passages.content:
We travel back to Lima. Mr. Jones is very silent and keeps his own company. Sir William, Marcellus and Miller keep Parker around: but there is little love lost between the remaining representative of the East India Company on one side and the envoy of the Parliamant on the other side. The teniente leads his men during the day and rides my at night. 
[Image: lted]
One time when he pulls out he tels me: "I was hoping you to be a little more ...enthusiastic.. .now that you are my wife." 

I raise an eyebrow: "This is a tale of betrayals so far. Will you introduce me to your family as your wife, teniente?" 

He pulls his pants up: "I am sorry to see that you are smarter than you look, little whore. No, I will not. The marriage was a fake to make you happy and get you to come to the rescure in case anyhting went wrong. Well: not you. Miller and Parker as your servants. 
Before you ask: one can fake marriages by taking a wrong name, giving the presiding padre a letter with the intent not to really marry that woman before the ceremony and by not exchanging wedding bands but only putting a ring on her finger. Marriages need intent, ceremony and will. None was given: we are not married. 
My real name does not matter, but I am a noble with a four-parted shield: from an old, venerable noble house. I do not marry Bretish whores." He shrugs and pats my wet bush: "Does that mean I have to pay from now on?" 
In a manner of speaking...
passages.content_zh:
我們返回利馬。瓊斯先生非常沉默寡言，獨來獨往。威廉爵士、馬塞勒斯和米勒將帕克留在身邊：但一方是東印度公司的剩餘代表，另一方是議會特使，他們之間幾乎沒有失去任何愛。中尉白天帶領他的部下，晚上騎著我。 
[圖：lted]
有一次，當他退出時，他告訴我：“我希望你能更……熱情一點……現在你是我的妻子了。”

我揚起一邊眉毛：“到目前為止，這是一個關於背叛的故事。中尉，你願意把我介紹給你的家人作為你的妻子嗎？”

他拉起褲子：「我很遺憾看到你比看起來更聰明，小妓女。不，我不會。這樁婚姻是假的，目的是為了讓你快樂，並讓你在出現任何問題時前來救援。好吧：不是你。米勒和帕克是你的僕人。
在你提問之前：人們可以透過用錯名字、給主持神父一封信，意圖在儀式前不與那個女人真正結婚、不交換結婚戒指而只在她的手指上戴上一枚戒指來假結婚。婚姻需要意圖、儀式和意願。沒有給任何資訊：我們還沒有結婚。 
我的真名並不重要，但我是一位擁有四瓣盾牌的貴族：來自古老而令人尊敬的貴族家族。我不會娶英國妓女。他聳聳肩，拍拍我濕淋淋的灌木叢：「那是不是意味著從現在開始我就得付錢了？ 」
某種程度上來說...

passages.name: g43
passages.content:
- A week later, near Lima City - 
The duchess sits up in her bed when I pinch her nose. She looks at me, then out of the window: the moon is shining. 
Her Grace looks at me again: "I guess it is about three o'clock in the morning. I am in my bed in my castle. Outside my door are my servants and my guards. I am quite certain that I did not invite a young, British looking woman into my bedchamber. What exactly are you doing here?" 

I smile: "Your son has inherited your strength of will. Very good, because we need to talk, duchess. Oh, I know that you are to be adressed as 'your grace'. But I do not think that your family is very graceful, and I am on the verge of obliterating your house. Since you are powerful and therefore stupid, let me put it in simple words: I have your son, and I WILL rip your throat out if we do not come to an arangement." 

Her grace raises an eyebrow: "My son has written me not to worry about certain rumours. Rumours that he had married a whore. I guess that would be you, and that you are unhappy about being cheated out of a marriage far above your station." 

I shrug: "There is no station in hell, but there are a lot of nobles. Probably all your family." 

Her grace shrugs: "My aunt was very pious. I understand that you are blackmailing me with the death of my son and threatening to kill me." I nod. She shrugs again: "Well, you cannot marry my son. He is not the heir, but you are not becoming a member of MY house like that. I do have an offer to make, though: my daughters were ....lively young damsels. If either of them had had an accident before their weddings I would have arranged a marriage with an elderly and impoverished nobleman. No riches, no political power but a wedding band and an old name. I can get that for you. 
Deliver my son to me -healthy- and you have my word." 

I smile and kiss her on the forehead: "If this is another betrayal, there will be hell to pay." 
I probably should not agree to such a scam...
passages.content_zh:
- 一週後，利馬市附近 -
當我捏住公爵夫人的鼻子時，她從床上坐了起來。她看著我，然後看著窗外：月光燦爛。 
女王陛下再次看著我：“我猜現在是凌晨三點左右。我正在城堡的床上。門外是我的僕人和守衛。我很確定我沒有邀請一個年輕的英國女人進入我的臥室。你到底在這裡做什麼？”

我微笑道：「你的兒子繼承了你的意志力。很好，因為我們需要談談，公爵夫人。哦，我知道你應該被尊稱為『閣下』。但我不認為你的家族很有風度，我正處於毀滅你的家族的邊緣。既然你很強大，所以很愚蠢，讓我用簡單的話來說：我有你的兒子，如果我們不達成協議，我就會撕掉你的喉嚨。」

她的格蕾絲揚起一邊眉毛：“我兒子寫信給我，讓我不要擔心某些謠言。謠言說他娶了一個妓女。我猜那人就是你，而且你因為被欺騙而脫離了遠高於你地位的婚姻而感到不高興。”

我聳聳肩：“地獄裡沒有車站，但貴族很多。可能都是你的家人。”

葛蕾絲聳聳肩：「我姑姑很虔誠，我明白你是用我兒子的死來敲詐我，威脅要殺了我。」我點點頭。她再次聳聳肩：「好吧，你不能嫁給我的兒子。他不是繼承人，但你不能像那樣成為我家族的一員。不過，我確實有一個提議：我的女兒們都是……活潑的年輕少女。如果她們中的任何一個在婚禮前發生了意外，我會安排與一位年長而貧窮的貴族結婚。沒有財富，沒有政治權力，只有一枚結婚戒指和一個古老的名字。
把我的兒子交給我——健康的——我向你保證。 」

我微笑著在她的額頭上親了一下：“如果這又是一次背叛，你將付出慘痛的代價。”
我可能不應該同意這樣的騙局......

passages.name: g44
passages.content:
Strangely enough the duchess is good for her word. I hand her back her son and she hands me the marriage papers. My husband is a senile old man, but he is alive and -formally- agrees to marry me. No sex here -he is not up to that- but under Spanish law consumption is not required. 

We return to Britan on the same ship: Sir William, his son Marcelus, Mr. Jones, Parker and me. My husband dies of old age during the voyage: but all aboard know that he was my husband and that he died of natural causes. 

Parker and Marcelus are angry about getting kicked out of the country: the duchess has seen to that. But Sir Wiliam is not. 

Mr. Jones is polite with me and always adresses me with my new name and title, but he is ...disturbed. When I ask why, he shrugs: "I am working with the King's administration to defend Britain against outer and inner enemies. As a personal hobby I have debunked fake cults and religions. 
Now I learn that YOU are a ...wizard? Sorceress? That MAGIC is real, that there are monsters out there other than the villains working for the East India Company and that certain ...plans by rich fools may not be foolish only but also dangerous. 
I need to do some research, given that there are monsters to be sought out in the wilderness. If so, I may need a ...soercerss... that is willing to help with the survival of mankind. 
But until then, if you do not mind, I would rather distance myself from you. I am not even wether I like you less for lying on that table, naked with that teniente using you like a whore ...or killing that monster, Mendoza, with a look and what I think was a spell." 

I can understand him being afraid of a sorceress. But I DO mind being treated like a whore because I was powerless and got abused. If he ever needs help, it will cost me an effort to render that help.
passages.content_zh:
奇怪的是，公爵夫人言出必行。我把她的兒子還給她，她把結婚證書遞給我。我的丈夫是一位高齡老人，但他還活著，並且正式同意嫁給我。這裡沒有性行為——他沒有能力做到這一點——但根據西班牙法律，消費是不需要的。 

我們搭乘同一艘船返回英國：威廉爵士、他的兒子馬塞勒斯、瓊斯先生、帕克和我。我的丈夫在航行中老死了，但船上的人都知道他是我的丈夫，而且是自然死亡的。 

帕克和馬塞勒斯對被驅逐出境感到憤怒：公爵夫人已經做到了這一點。但威廉爵士不是。 

瓊斯先生對我很有禮貌，總是用我的新名字和頭銜稱呼我，但他……很不安。當我問為什麼時，他聳聳肩：「我正在與國王政府合作，保衛英國免受外部和內部敵人的侵害。作為個人愛好，我揭穿了虛假的邪教和宗教。
現在我知道你是個……巫師？女巫？這種魔法是真實的，除了為東印度公司工作的惡棍之外，還有怪物，而且富人傻瓜的某些計劃可能不僅愚蠢，而且危險。 
我需要做一些研究，因為荒野裡有怪物需要尋找。如果是這樣，我可能需要一個願意幫助人類生存的……巫師……。 
但在那之前，如果你不介意的話，我寧願和你保持距離。我甚至不知道我是否因為你赤身裸體地躺在那張桌子上而讓那個中尉像妓女一樣使用你……或者用一個眼神和我認為是咒語的方式殺死了那個怪物門多薩。 」

我可以理解他害怕女巫。但我確實介意被當作妓女對待，因為我無能為力並受到虐待。如果他需要幫助，我會付出很大的努力來幫忙。

passages.name: g45
passages.content:
- Back in London, Great Britain - 

[Image: tea]Mrs. Woodridge sets her tea cup back to the saucer with some meaning lost to me. Her other guests do not seem to understand her meaning, either: our hostess has also invited a newcomer to polite society. 

Mr. Hantley 'is in buttons', as polite society is want to say. A merchant and producer of the essential accesoire much needed by any damsel and lady. Pearls are great, but one NEEDS buttons. Therefore Mr. Hantley is rich and Mrs. Hantley is trying to get the family some acceptance in new social heights: the "ton", the British gentles. Not exactly nobility -some nobles rub shoulders with them, though- but much elevated from mere middle class men like merchants. 

Miss Lucy is the niece by marriage of our host. She is trying to be a free spirit, a wild damsel: but her ideas of being wild are walks in the moor by herself. 

I am, of course, the daughter of a respected member of the ton -Sir William  Marston- that has come back from foreign travels with a ring on my finger, a silly foreign name and a falling out with my family. Stinks to high heavens, if you ask certain matrons and rumour mongers. Other matrons shrug and point out that I have a good personal income -and seem to own the family mansion, Marston Manor- and that I DO wear a wedding band and a noble title: if a foreign one. 

"Better than nothing", these matrons say: quoting Shakespear's wordplay about 'country matters'.
passages.content_zh:
- 回到英國倫敦 -

[圖：茶]女士。伍德里奇將她的茶杯放回碟子上，我失去了一些意義。她的其他客人似乎也不明白她的意思：我們的女主人也邀請了一位上流社會的新人。 

正如上流社會所說，漢特利先生「穿著紐帶」。任何一位女士和女士都急需的基本配件的商人和生產商。珍珠很棒，但需要紐扣。因此，漢特利先生很富有，而漢特利夫人則試圖讓這個家庭在新的社會高度上得到一些認可：“ton”，即英國紳士。不完全是貴族——不過有些貴族與他們並肩——但比商人這樣的中產階級人士要高得多。 

露西小姐是我們主人的婚外甥女。她試著成為一個自由的精神，一個狂野的少女：但她對狂野的想法是獨自在荒野中散步。 

當然，我是一位受人尊敬的威廉·馬斯頓爵士的女兒，他從國外旅行回來，手指上戴著戒指，有一個愚蠢的外國名字，而且與家人鬧翻了。如果你去問某些主婦和謠言傳播者，你會發現這真是臭氣沖天。其他主婦聳聳肩，指出我有不錯的個人收入——而且似乎擁有家族宅邸馬斯頓莊園——而且我確實戴著結婚戒指和高貴的頭銜：如果是外國的話。 

這些女士們引用莎士比亞關於「國家事務」的雙關語說，「總比沒有好」。

Mrs. Woodridge sighs and tells us: "Our good fellow here, Mrs. Hantley, has come to me with a request. That was a very fine choice, dear. Of course I will help you. But, alas, I am dreadfully busy myself. But Miss Timmons and even the far-travelled Damisela Ashley will be available to help you." 

I raise an eyebrow: "Lucy, go show Mrs. Hantley the garden, please. Now." Lucy is not having one of her "wild" moments -she might have hesitated in such an act of rebellion- but does as I have told her. Mrs. Hantrey follows her eagerly. Maybe it is not Lucy being a coward but me letting my anger show. I need to work on that. 

When they are gone, I turn to Mrs. Woodridge. "My father is your equal, socially. A gentleman like you are a gentlewoman, Mrs. Woodridge. I have married up. I do not care about your idea of British prerrogative: I am listed in the Who-Is-Who as a dowager baronet. THAT is my status. I am rubbing shoulders with my -nominal- social inferiors because REAL nobles treat me like you treat Mrs. Hantley: a social climber and a mild curiosity at best. Nonetheles I AM your social superior. 

You are obviously building a saloon. Good luck with that. Social affiars are a multitude of inteconnecting webs. I am very willing to be a lesser noble in your aquaintance. Having a noble around should help with your plans to attract followers. If you are sucessful, being a visiting member of your saloon will in turn allow me access to your connections. That is how the game is played. 

You do NOT give me orders, and you do NOT assign me a social rank that you think is fitting. I was married in a cathedral, with a duchess in attendance, and I am a widow because the Baronet was older than me and ocean travel is dangerous. Nonetheless I AM a dowager baronet, and you will treat me as such.

我扬起一边眉毛：“露西，请带汉特利夫人参观花园。现在。”露西并没有经历她的“狂野”时刻——她可能会在这种叛逆行为中犹豫不决——而是按照我告诉她的那样做了。漢特里夫人熱切地跟著她。也許不是露西膽小，而是我把憤怒表現出來了。我需要為此努力。

[Image: tea]When we are all at the table again, Mrs. Woodridge smiles gently and pours everyone 'a good cup of tea'. "Lady Ashley has pointed out that I need to be more precise with my request: very correctly so, of course. 

Mr. Hantley is looking for some art to celebrate beauty at his home: modern art because Mr. Hantley is a modern man. Wisely Mr. Hantley has asked Mrs. Hantley to find him some high quality, impressive painting: preferable by a modern artist that will do well with some patronage. 

To be blunt: buying from a yet unkown taleent is both merritful in the eyes of polite society and a sound business arrangement. 

I would like the two of you, Miss Lucy and Lady Ashly, to accompany Mrs. Hantley to a painter that I have heard of. He is living in a less desirable part of the greater city, and I would not want to send a lady there alone by herself." 
She smiles and asks me: "Would you be able to take the time and accompany my good fellow and my nieve, Lady Ashley?" 

I nod gravely: "I will happily do that, Mrs. Woodridge." 

No one asks Mrs. Hantley or Lucy. Politey society is no democracy or anything wicked like that.

我希望你們兩位，露西小姐和艾希莉女士，陪漢特利太太去看一位我聽過的畫家。他住在大城市的一個不太理想的地方，我不想派一位女士獨自去那裡。 」
她微笑著問我：“阿什利女士，你能抽出時間陪我的好夥伴和我的侄女嗎？”

我鄭重地點點頭：“我很樂意這麼做，伍德里奇夫人。”

Mrs. Hantley sighs: "I greatly enjoy speedy travel, Lady Baronet. I also feel honoured that we can use your coach. But may I ask whether your coachman has a lot of experience?" 

I gently try to get Miss Lucy to let go off her holds: "This is the door, Lucy. If you let go we can get out. You can stand on the street when we get out. On your feet. You like being on your feet and having control, don't you?" I smile at her charmingly and pat Lucy's hand. 

I nod at Miller on the coachman's seat. "My coachman used to be a soldier, then he entered the service of Sir William. A diplomat sometimes needs a ...security detail, so to speak. When I left home after my marriage, Miller stayed with me. Coach driving is a skill that Miller is learning, but he is a veteran of our wars against that terrible little man. He is good with horses." 
..and mules, guns and explosives. But one does not mention matters of violence in polite society any easier than matters of sex.

漢特利夫人嘆了口氣：“我非常喜歡快速旅行，從男爵夫人。我也很榮幸我們能使用您的馬車。不過請問您的馬車夫經驗豐富嗎？”

我輕輕地試圖讓露西小姐放開她的手：「這是門，露西。如果你放手，我們就可以出去。我們出去後，你可以站在街上。站起來。你喜歡站起來並掌控一切，不是嗎？」我對她迷人地微笑，拍拍露西的手。 

我向車夫座位上的米勒點點頭。 「我的馬車夫曾經是一名士兵，後來為威廉爵士服務。可以這麼說，外交官有時需要……安保人員。當我結婚後離開家時，米勒陪著我。駕駛馬車是米勒正在學習的一項技能，但他是我們對抗那個可怕的小個子的戰爭的老兵。他很擅長騎馬。”
..還有騾子、槍和炸藥。但在上流社會中，提及暴力問題並不比提及性議題容易。
